column2: Yes. As of May 25, places of worship such as churches, mosques, and synagogues can open throughout the state, with modifications.

You can travel for urgent matters or if such travel is essential to your permitted work. Non-essential travel for vacations or pleasure should be avoided. This is to slow the spread of the coronavirus.
It depends. If your county has been approved to move further into Stage 2, then hair salons and barber shops may reopen in your area. See the list of counties that are allowed

column1: What are the symptoms of COVID-19?
column2:
COVID-19 Symptoms include:
* Fever
* Cough
* Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
* Chills
* Repeated shaking with chills
* Muscle pain
* Headache
* Sore throat
* New loss of taste or smell

More info: (https://covid19.ca.gov/testing-and-treatment/)

column1: Is there a COVID-19 symptoms self-checker?
column2:
Yes, you can check your symptoms by using the Symptom Screener self-checker or by contacting your doctor through telehealth.

More info: 
(https://covid19.ca.gov/testing-and-treatment/)

column1: Who are high risk people for COVID-19?
column2:
People who are at higher risk to get very sick from COVID-19, including:
* people over 65 years old
* people with compromised immune systems
* Individuals who have serious chronic medical conditions like:
* Heart disease
* Diabetes
* Lung disease
* Smokers

More info: 

(https://covid19.ca.gov/testing-and-treatment/)

column1: How can I find a coronavirus testing location near me?
Is there a dive-through coronavirus testing location near me?
Can I get a free coronavirus test?
column2: Yes, if you qualify. More info \n\n[Testing and treatmeent](https://covid19.ca.gov/testing-and-treatment/)

column1: What coronavirus/COVID-19 symptoms require immediate medical attention?
column2:
Seek emergency medical attention if you have any of the following warning signs:
* Trouble breathing
* Persistent pain or pressure in the chest
* New confusion or inability to awaken
* Bluish lips or face

[Testing and treatmeent](https://covid19.ca.gov/testing-and-treatment/)	https://covid19.ca.gov/testing-and-treatment/

No. Please see California Health Corps page under Step 1, a valid California license is required for clinical practice (if you are a MD, DO, etc.).
